intro: Erophila verna var. major, commonly known as the early violet, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is a member of the Violaceae family and is characterized by its heart-shaped leaves and delicate purple flowers that bloom in early spring. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as woodlands and stream banks. It has a short growing season and is often found in calcareous soils. The species is also known for its medicinal properties and has been used in traditional herbal remedies.
